perturbation.original_text: 7.1 The Executive shall be paid a basic salary of £448,903 per annum subject to deductions required by law. The Executive's salary shall accrue from day to day, shall be payable in equal monthly instalments in arrears on or about the last day of each month.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 The Executive shall be paid a basic salary of £448,903 per annum subject to deductions required by law. The Executive's salary shall accrue from day to day, shall be payable in equal monthly instalments in arrears on or about the 15th day of each month.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction. Originally, salary payments were due on or about the last day of the month. Now, payments are due on or about the 15th, conflicting with the prior clause. This creates uncertainty regarding the payment deadline, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
12.3 The Executive shall have no entitlement to any payment in lieu of accrued but untaken holiday except on Termination. The amount of such payment in lieu shall be 1/260 of the Executive's salary for each untaken day of entitlement.

12.4 If on Termination the Executive has taken in excess of their accrued holiday entitlement, the Company shall be entitled to recover from the Executive by way of deduction from any payments due to the Executive or otherwise, one day's pay for each excess day calculated at 1/260 of the Executive's salary.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.3 The Executive shall have no entitlement to any payment in lieu of accrued but untaken holiday except on Termination. The amount of such payment in lieu shall be 1/260 of the Executive's salary for each untaken day of entitlement.

12.4 If on Termination the Executive has taken in excess of their accrued holiday entitlement, the Company shall be entitled to recover from the Executive by way of deduction from any payments due to the Executive or otherwise, one day's pay for each excess day calculated at 1/250 of the Executive's salary.
perturbation.explanation: The fraction used to calculate the deduction for excess holiday taken on termination is changed from 1/260 to 1/250. This creates a conflict in how the overpayment is calculated, leading to ambiguity and potential disputes on termination.
The minimum advance written notice is changed from 6 weeks to 4 weeks. This directly contradicts the original notice period, creating ambiguity about the required notice period for termination.
